Key Arguments: The legislation is fundamentally about censorship and an infringement on free speech.
Government is often the main source of misinformation and disinformation.
The proposed legislation could lead to government overreach and suppression of dissenting opinions.
There is no single source of truth, and people should be allowed to access diverse information to make informed decisions.
The legislation could lead to 'mission creep' where initial regulations expand to more draconian measures.
Notable Quotes: The cure for bad speech is good speech.
Government dis- and misinformation is what needs to be controlled and exposed.
Nineteen Eighty Four was meant to be a warning, not an instruction manual.
